net.jsoundsystem
Class JSoundSystem

java.lang.Object
  net.jsoundsystem.JSoundSystem

public abstract class JSoundSystem
extends java.lang.Object

The main overlay API to create JSounds among other things. Current supported sounds are OGG, WAV, AIFF, SND, AIFC, FLAC, AU and MP3

Author:
Johan Jansen

Method Detail

getSoundsPlaying

public static int getSoundsPlaying()
Gets the number of channels in use

createSound

public static JSound createSound(java.io.File soundFile)
                          throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                                 java.io.IOException
This is the same as calling "new JSound(File soundFile)". With this method you can create JSound objects from any specified File. This function will fail if the specified sound is not supported or if the file does not exist.

Parameters:
soundFile - A File object pointing to the audio file you want to use
Returns:
A JSound object ready to be played
Throws:
javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - If the audio format is not supported by the JSoundSystem
java.io.IOException - If the audio file could not be read
See Also:
JSound

createSound

public static JSound createSound(java.lang.String soundFile)
                          throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                                 java.io.IOException
This is the same as calling "new JSound(File soundFile)". With this method you can create JSound objects from any specified String. This function will fail if the specified sound is not supported or if the file does not exist.

Parameters:
soundFile - A String with the file path of the audio file you want to use
Returns:
A JSound object ready to be played
Throws:
javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - If the audio format is not supported by the JSoundSystem
java.io.IOException - If the audio file could not be read
See Also:
JSound

setMaxChannels

public static void setMaxChannels(int amount)
This function sets the amount of sound channels that can be used at the same time. Sound channels define the number of sounds that can be played at the same time. The maximum limit depends on the audio drivers of the computer. The default amount is 32.

Parameters:
amount - The maximum amount of channels that can be allocated
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if amount is negative or less than the number of channels in use

hasFreeChannels

public static boolean hasFreeChannels()
Returns true if there is at least one free channel

soundIsSupported

public static boolean soundIsSupported(java.io.File soundFile)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Finds out if the specified File is supported as an AudioInputStream and if it can be used as a JSound. Returns true if it is supported or False otherwise.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the File cannot be read

create3DSound

public static JSound create3DSound(java.io.File soundFile)
                            throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                                   java.io.IOException
Works like the createSound( File soundFile ) except that it will return a JSound3D object. A JSound3D will automatically simulate 3D positional audio for you. You need to set the sound source, listener source and maximum sound distance for this to properly work.

Parameters:
soundFile -
Returns:
A JSound3D object with default source at position (0, 0)
Throws:
javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - If the audio format is not supported by the JSoundSystem
java.io.IOException - If the audio file could not be read
See Also:
JSound3D

setListenerPosition

public static void setListenerPosition(Vector3f listenerPosition)
This sets or changes the position of the listener. This is only used by JSound3D who use this to simulate 3D positional sounds. The default position is (0, 0, 0)

Parameters:
listenerPosition - A 3 dimensional x y z floating point coordinate
See Also:
JSound3D

setMaxDistance

public static void setMaxDistance(float distance)
This sets the maximum distance from where sounds can be heard using 3D sound simulation The default value is 800. The distance cannot be set below 1 or an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

Parameters:
distance -
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the distance is set to 1 or less.
See Also:
JSound3D

getListenerPosition

public static Vector3f getListenerPosition()
This returns the current position of the listener. The default position is (0, 0)

Returns:
listenerPosition
See Also:
JSound3D

getMaxDistance

public static float getMaxDistance()
Returns the current max hearing distance. Default is 800.

Returns:
